title: [Health] New research indicates that e-cigarettes can cause cellular and molecular changes in the lungs. Specifically, prolonged inhalation of e-cigarette aerosols by mice caused changes in the animalsâ€™ pulmonary immune cell composition and altered gene and protein levels in the lungs
[Cancer] By using artificial human skin, a research group from the University of Copenhagen have managed to block invasive growth in a skin cancer model
